intro: Merathrepta intermedia subsp. cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
